favourite.article: The Holy Spirit dropped this song in my heart this morning so I quickly searched google and found it on this site. As I sing, it puts eternity in my focus, the beautiful mansions beyond the blue. Glory! Haleluyah!

It was the most wonderful day of my life when I first heard this song at my friend's place at Ibadan, it was inspiring to me, and I had a soul lifting moment, I got lifted in my spirit that I started shedding tears, ever since then, this song has become a favourite that I can't do without, in fact I sought for the lyrics on google and still searching for where to pick its CD, thank God for the life of the composer, I'm indeed blessed having this song in my memory...........
Can I get this song in kikuyu language?

After being alone with God yesterday, this was the song that came to my spirit this morning so I sang it. It's my regular companion when I want to commune with Him even when I'm in the car and each time I play it, I feel His presence more. It inspires me and helps me to remember that Christ lives in me and this is the only hope of glory. It's an encouragement for a more intimate relationship with the Lord.

Hearing this timeless hymn I remember my involvement with CAPRO at the last days gatherings in JOS. The dissection of truth and heavenly consciousness is a memory I will never forget as we often close with this hymn.

Blessings of the Lord to both my parents who took me to Church regularly as a child and sent me to Christian governed Schools in my formative years until I went to professional training institution. I am very grateful to Dr. Ezekiel Funso Omowo who, by the Spirit leading conveyed to me what it means to be a Christian; and I am forever grateful to God for my Pastor, Choir Master and Mentor, Revd. Gabriel Farombi who raised me up as young believer and pushed me hard to be really a responsible and accountable Christian. I don't remember where I first learned this awesome and inspiring song in my pilgrimage so far, it was somewhere in my journey above. Today, I have been reading Ezra 8, then referred to Esther 1 for some reason, then back to Ezra 8, when I was reminded again that everything that pertains to life and fruitfulness can ONLY be due to God's presence. Leading me to unearth this timeless hymn in my depth and search for its full lyrics. A lot better, more spiritual and more meaningful than the current psychedelic Christian songs, I would agree. My confession: You are my everlasting Portion, Jesus Christ. My Prayer: Please let me CLOSELY WALK WITH YOU. Amen!
This hymn carries me away always. I feel like flying away with it. What a hymn, so inspiring!

To God be the glory for this blessed song from a blessed heart. Tears flow freely from my heart today as I cried singing this hymn. What else do I want from life than to be closer to my maker. My prayer is when the gate is opened, let me enter with Thee O Lord.

Just as I began to worship on the mountain at 4am, having the thought to pour out my heart, I remembered Students Congress held in Gboko Nigeria 2008, where I first heard this hymn; my cares then gave way to my passion "To be close to God". What a longing...
I will be a year older tomorrow so I sing this song to You my Master, King and Lord to grant me fresh grace, zeal, love and faith to continue my walk with You while doing Your will.

What a challenge, if a blind woman - Fanny Jane Crosby could do this ever inspiring, timeless and ageless song for the Lord since the 17th century, may we all ask ourselves what legacy we are leaving behind in the sands of time as we go. Fanny has been resting in the bosom of the master she loved so much, while the impact of her work while here on earth continues to affect generation after generation for our Lord Jesus Christ. May the Lord help us and our generation to serve him as these old saints did. Amen.
What else does man need, just be close to God. We sung this hymn this morning and I knew it was a prayer from my heart. I just browsed looking for it because I just want to sing again and again!
I just remembered this song, and I had to browse for it. The song reminds me that I have to be closer to God. Pls pray for me.
I fondly remember singing this hymn on a Sunday. Bringing back memories of my grandfolks, my parents and my uncle Ivan singing with gusto in the Apostolic Unity Church Lansdowne Congregation
This song is a blessing to my soul. Lord it doesn't matter how much I toil and suffer; only, only let me walk with Thee.
This song never ceases to touch my core any time. Phew!!!

This hymn reminds me of our helplessness and total dependence on our Maker. We are strangers and pilgrims in this world (1 Pet 2:11). To make it Home, we need a close walk with our Maker. We need to walk with Him like this hymn says.
This song is never old. It is new everyday in my soul. Sing it and believe it. We shall all make heaven at last in Jesus Name. Thanks for uploading this song. God bless you.

This is a daily song for pilgrims. I have always been blessed and strengthened why I sing this hymn written by holy men of God. It was not written to make money or for entertainment but an expression of their lives and focus on the cross of Christ. This songs are timeless because they were lifted by the Holy Spirit from a regenerated life. Oh may I continue to come close to thee till I see You face to face.
This is a song for every Christian to sing and meditates on every day It will help us in our Christian journey.

Let's turn the hymn into prayer. Lord, then the gate of life eternal, let me enter with Thee! Whatever would not want me to enter with Thee, please, remove it! Every form of sin, I confess and repent, by the blood of Jesus, remove it! My ultimate goal in life is to enter into life eternal with Thee my Lord and Saviour, make it possible for me in Jesus name! Amen! It's a song that every Christian should be singing regularly; at least, once a week. God bless you as you read this comment and I pray that you and I would be counted worthy to enter into the gate of life eternal with The Lord in Jesus name! Amen!
I've always loved hymns; words can't express what happens within me when I sing or just hear the melody of these songs.
I live in a country where I can still proclaim CHRIST JESUS boldly. This song helps me do it. thank You JEHOVAH!!!!!

I couldn't understand as a child, growing up when my Mom used to cry, and SING this SONG. I thought She was Crazy; Now that my grown, and FACING MY OWN TRIALS and TRIBULATION, THIS IS THE SONG THAT SOOTHES AND COMFORTS ME ON A DAILY BASIS. MY GOD BLESS THE WRITER. TRULY BLESSES MY SOUL.
This is amazing. Calling for a deep thought as a pilgrimage here. May His love leads me through.
Keep us closer to Thee oh Lord in Jesus Name. Draw us nearer everyday and make us faithful always oh Lord. Thanks for uploading this song.

I have sung this Hymn in church for as long as I can remember but this week we are starting a 4 day revival with speaker Rev. Levi Parish. We will use this hymn as a call to revival each night. The hymn is already blessing my heart.
A superb one, I never grow weary singing this hymn.

I sing this hymn more than any other hymns. It is echoed daily in my heart, as I wake up daily. I beg of God to draw me closer, daily to Him as I am inspired to be closer than ever till our Saviour's return.

I always feel lifted and strengthened whenever I listen or sing this song knowing assuredly that whatever is my portion in this life means nothing to me as long as God is my everlasting portion who is closer to me more than friend or life itself. Hallelluyah! What a glorious hope we have through our Lord Jesus Christ.

My mum loved hymns so much! But she is singing forever more in God's presence now... I was thinking of her and missing her when I decided to google search her, and found that she came to this site. Wasn't surprised that it was a hymn site. But what more, it was comforting and somewhat bitter-sweet to see this was the hymn she listened to. Indeed, God was her everlasting Portion, and more than friend or life to her. And along her pilgrim journey, Jesus our Savior, walked with her...
Hallelujah for such hope in eternal life. Miss you so much Mum... You are among the cloud of witnesses now... I long to be with Jesus, my Savior and you too, when the time comes...
Mrs Hephzibah Igberaese (10/03/60-25/07/13)
Let The Church Say AMEN, AMEN, AMEN.
so much purer and better than the secular so called Christian music nowadays.
Well this is a wonderful song. However, I have always heard it sung much slower, so I almost did not recognize it except for the words. Since this is a hymn, try it at a slower pace.
Oh! Lord help me to be close to Thee throughout.

A Scottish minister once told Fanny Crosby that it was too bad that God had allowed her to become blind. Crosby quickly responded, "If I had been given a choice at birth, I would have asked to be blind ... for when I get to heaven, the first face I will see will be the one who died for me." That desire to see Jesus, to be close to Him, was always foremost in her mind. When Silas Jones Vail, who was a Long Island hatter by trade, said he had a tune for Crosby, she asked him to play it for her. As he was playing it, Crosby said, "That refrain said 'Close to Thee, close to Thee, close to Thee, close to Thee.'" -Great Songs of Faith by Brown & Norton
Dwelling with the Master makes the Difference always. My soul touching hymn always BLESSED.
This hymn is so uplifting. It's my spirit- inspired hymn for the year, so far.
I never knew this beautiful hymn was written by beloved Fanny Crosby. I am deeply blessed by its lyrics and rhythm.
Praise Jesus the Lord of lords!
